t: The Lord Is in His Holy Temple
In*pn the Lord*s I take refuge; how*ln can you say to my soul, “Flee*ld like a bird to your mountain,
for*ln behold, the wicked bend the bow; they*ld have fitted their arrow to the string to*ld shoot in the dark at the upright in heart;
if*ln the foundations are destroyed, what*ld can the righteous do?”
The*pn Lord*s is in his holy temple; the*ld Lord’s*s throne is in heaven; his*ld eyes see, his eyelids test the children of man.
The*ln Lord*s tests the righteous, but*ld his soul hates the wicked and the one who loves violence.
Let*ln him rain coals on the wicked; fire*ld and sulfur and a scorching wind shall be the portion of their cup.
For*ln the Lord*s is righteous; he*ln loves righteous deeds; the*ld upright shall behold his face.
